Author: d3n#0940
Content: I've been reading about the Komodo CryptoConditions. Congratulations! It looks to me like a very powerful technology. My question, which I've not found answered in any of the current texts, is: How a zk-snark transactions can be used with UTXO based smart contracts? Is there any way with the current implementation?

Author: d3n#0940
Content:
Of course I'm thinking on privacy powered Voting system. For such thing we need mainly:
+ A way to sign claims (like address X is able to vote). This might be achieved by just adding a signed claim to a blockchain  block
+ A way to create a temporary assetchain. This seems that can be avhieved using CryptoConditions
+ A way to use this temporary assetchain tokens from a Zk-snark transactions which will have the voting option encapsuled in MeMo field

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
Can patreon.com be replicated via cc? It needs an address1 for the creator which will receive payments in regular intervals(1 month/1 week) and address2 for each donor that will hold funds to be sent to all the creators the donor wishes

Also oracle cc can be used to replicate the pay per video/music/blog post produced model

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: need to have a bit more clarity on what the rules are but it seems close to what I have in mind for payments CC

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
Model1: Content creator posts address ---> Donor will tell his dapp send this creator 1 KMD every month

Model2: Content creator posts address + somehow notifies the that he has produced a new  video --> Donor tells his dapp to send the creator 10 KMD for each video produced

these are what are happening at a high level

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: Donor has the ability to stop this donation any time

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: oracles CC kind of does this already. donors prepay for content, content providers receive payment when data is posted

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
Yes oracles cc does model 2
I was thinking about model 1

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, payments CC will do something similar to that

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: Got it

Author: MoldyLunchbox#5734
Content:
Hello! I have a simple question that might appear pointless, but I must know the answer to.
Is JL777 obsessed with reptiles? I'm asking as an amateur myself. I love the Komodo project and the reptile references are really fun.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: being in this community for so long and have many interactions with jl777 during this time, I'd say the reptile names isn't an obsession.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: it all started with a project evolving to new iteration/version and naming it to "iguana"

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: we did not had any official cryptocurrency which was made by jl777, there was NXT that jl777 made project on top of, and there was BTCD, which was created by another developer and jl777 joined him help this coin.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: Komodo got many technologies jl777 built in "iguana" and it's earlier codebase versions which derived from MultiGateway tech and it's related required parts of evolving code and various different ideas.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: and since Komodo was from lizard family, the project's sub features also got names from the same theme

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: like Basilisk, Agama, etc.

Author: MoldyLunchbox#5734
Content: I see. Thank you.

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: hey jl777 just wondering what're your thoughts on alternative mining algorithms? Obviously PoW is proving to be solid and mixed with dPoW is even better. But I'm curious on what you think Komodo providing additional mining algorithms to be available for KMD ACs (already have PoS and hybrid, as well as MN using nlocktime).

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: support for other hashing algo will come with verus pull request

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: You mean the VerusHash algorithm?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: specifically, but it adds support for changing of hashalgo

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the first one is always the most work, adding a second, third, should be much simpler to do

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I dont think many appreciate just how much new territory VRSC has achieved

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: It's definitely impressive, and the most recent spotlight did a great job showing that. But that makes a lot of sense, changing the algorithm becomes easier after the first time. I was reading about that solar-powered transaction using shortwave radio waves on the Burst blockchain and remember reading a couple years ago about their Proof of Capacity and was curious if those drastically different consensus mechanisms could eventually be available.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: as long as the hashalgo is in C/C++, it would be possible to add, really not much interaction with anything else, so it is a relatively safe and easy change to make to consensus. that is why you see a lot of coins where all they change is the hashalgo

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: Cool, I assumed dPoW could still be a viable option for these non-PoW coins, like PoC, as it's storing the hash of their chain, but would probably need some additional aspect to prevent reversing transactions (not too fluent on PoC). It seemed that PoC could be susceptible to genesis attack.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: anything with 256byte blockhash can be dPoW'ed

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: Cool, good to know, pretty sure their project came from NXT, anyway seemed like a cool algorithm to eventually add to the KMD AC options, seeing as it's based on open disk space and external hard drives are getting bigger and cheaper (5TB is like 110KMD). Thanks for the info

Author: djay#5234
Content: I wanted to ask about jumblr, how secure is that against blockchain analysis, I understand that blocks are processed at the same hour for everybody but example if I will run 20k KMD through Jumblr from wallet A - it will do the shufling and even if I break it down into 20 or more wallets I will end up having 1K of komodo each but than if I will exchange all those into BTC the wallets will be linked together the alltogether value can be calculated and it's obvious that it was my wallet that shuffled 20k of KMD especially if Jumblr doesn't have any other activity

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: @djay  im no expert on this, but just use different wallets on komodos barterDEX, or just use a few different exchanges withdrawing to different wallets, and youll have like 1btc here, 1.4553 there, 2,2424 in another

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: nothing will link those btc wallets together

Author: djay#5234
Content: I think there is no or very few people using jumblr isn't that a point of failure ?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes until there is more JUMBLR usage, external analysis is possible. PIRATE aims to solve this by dramatically increasing the ztransaction activity within KMD

Author: sœÜldat#8733
Content: pirate and pex, can't it harm jumblr's activity and utility?

Author: sœÜldat#8733
Content: Or jumblr mechanism will be directly implemented in pex for KMD ? It's not clear in my mind

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: You can use JUMBLR only using Komodo native mode. Other coins or assetchain doesn't have this tech.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @sœÜldat my prediction is that PIRATE and pex (especially) will dramatically increase KMD zaddr usage

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: which in turn should create a critical mass of ztx within KMD to enable JUMBLR to be much more effective

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: since zaddr is required for PIRATE, it will force anybody that wants to buy PIRATE to make KMD zaddr

Author: sœÜldat#8733
Content: it's clear now, thanks

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: sometimes less is more, other times more is more

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: always need to analyze the situations specifics and think things through its most likely probabilities, not easy when complex tech is involved
